panels.description:
Percentage of available memory
Note: on modern Linux kernels, the amount of memory available to the application is not the same as the amount of free memory + cached + buffers.

targets.expr: avg by (instance) ((mongodb_sys_memory_MemAvailable_kb{} or (mongodb_sys_memory_MemFree_kb{} + mongodb_sys_memory_Buffers_kb{} + mongodb_sys_memory_Cached_kb{})) / mongodb_sys_memory_MemTotal_kb{} * 100)

panels.title: Memory available.

targets.expr:
avg by (env) (
  rate(mongodb_ss_opLatencies_latency{op_type="commands"}[5m])
  /
  ignoring(node_load1)
  rate(mongodb_ss_opLatencies_latency{op_type="commands"}[5m])
)
or
avg by (env) (
  irate(mongodb_ss_opLatencies_latency{op_type="commands"}[$__interval])
  /
  ignoring(node_load1)
  irate(mongodb_ss_opLatencies_latency{op_type="commands"}[$__interval])
)

panels.description: Connection pool available on the instance.
panels.title: Connections available.

panels.description: Connection distribution: Active, Current (average) and available.
panels.title: Connection status

panels.description: Average latency of operations (classified by read, write or (other) command).
panels.title: Latency time.

panels.description: Mesure du trafic réseau physique en entrée/sortie.
panels.title: Network I/O - Physical

panels.description: Operations categorized by legacy protocol type (query, insert, update, delete, get extra). And (from internal TTL threads) document deletes/sec by index TTL.
panels.title: Command Operations

panels.description: Docs per second, inserted, updated, deleted or returned. (N.b. not 1 to 1 with the number of operations).
panels.title: Document Operations

panels.description: Distribution by type of operations on documents.
panels.title: Distribution by type of operations.

panels.description: A high ratio may indicate suboptimal operations that scan a large number of documents to return only a small fraction.
panels.title: Document Query Executor

panels.description: Number of executions per second by operation type.
panels.title: Number of executions.

panels.description: This panel shows the number of assertion events per second on average over the given period. In most cases, assertions are trivial, but you should check your log files if this counter spikes or is consistently high.
panels.title: Assert Events

panels.description: Défauts de page mémoire sous Unix ou Window. Pas nécessairement de mongodb.
panels.title: Page Faults

panels.description: Nombre et durée totale, par seconde, de l'exécution des commandes getLastError pour confirmer les problèmes d'écriture.
panels.title: getLastError Write Time
